org.smpp

Class TCPIPConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.Connection
        • org.smpp.TCPIPConnection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SSLConnection

    public class TCPIPConnection
extends Connection
    Implementation of TCP/IP type of communication. Covers both client (peer-to-peer) connection and server (new connections from clients accepting and creating) type of connections.
    Version:
    $Id: TCPIPConnection.java 80 2009-10-28 02:13:18Z sverkera $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    Connection, Socket, ServerSocket, BufferedInputStream, BufferedOutputStream

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ServerSocketFactory serverSocketFactory
      Instanciate a ServerSocketFactory which will be used to create server sockets later.
      Socket socket
      The TCP/IP (client) socket.
      protected SocketFactory socketFactory
      Instanciate a SocketFactory which will be used to create sockets later.

      • Fields inherited from class org.smpp.Connection

        address

      • Fields inherited from class org.smpp.SmppObject

      Initialises the connection with existing socket.

      Initialises the connection for client communication.

    • Field Detail

      • socket

        public Socket socket
        The TCP/IP (client) socket.
        See Also:
        Socket

      • socketFactory

        protected SocketFactory socketFactory
        Instanciate a SocketFactory which will be used to create sockets later. Subclasses can override this field with e.g. a SSLSocketFactory

      • serverSocketFactory

        protected ServerSocketFactory serverSocketFactory
        Instanciate a ServerSocketFactory which will be used to create server sockets later. Subclasses can override this field with e.g. a SSLServerSocketFactory

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPIPConnection

        public TCPIPConnection(int port)
        Initialises the connection with port only, which means that the connection will serve as connection receiving server. The accepting of the connection must be invoked explicitly by calling of accept method.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number to listen on (or zero to assign an ephemeral port)

      • TCPIPConnection

        public TCPIPConnection(String address,
                       int port)
        Initialises the connection for client communication.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the remote end of the socket
        port - the port number on the remote host

      • TCPIPConnection

        public TCPIPConnection(Socket socket)
                throws IOException
        Initialises the connection with existing socket. It's intended for use with one server connection which generates new sockets and creates connections with the sockets.
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket to use for communication
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        accept()

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open()
          throws IOException
        Opens the connection by creating new Socket (for client type connection) or by creating ServerSocket (for server type connection). If the connection is already opened, the method is not doing anything.
        Specified by:
        open in class Connection
        Throws:
        IOException - Opening the connection can cause IOException in the derived classes.
        See Also:
        connType, ServerSocket, Socket

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes the client or server connection.
        Specified by:
        close in class Connection
        Throws:
        IOException - Closing the connection can cause IOException in the derived classes.
        See Also:
        connType, open()

      • send

        public void send(ByteBuffer data)
          throws IOException
        Sends data over the connection. Must be client type connection.
        Specified by:
        send in class Connection
        Parameters:
        data - the data which have to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException - Sending a data over connection can cause IOException in the derived classes.
        See Also:
        Socket

      • receive

        public ByteBuffer receive()
                   throws IOException
        Reads data from the connection. Must be client type connection. The timeout for receiving is set by setReceiveTimeout. The timeout for single attempt to read something from socket is set by setCommsTimeout.
        Specified by:
        receive in class Connection
        Returns:
        the data received from the connection
        Throws:
        IOException - Receiving data over connection can cause IOException in the derived classes.
        See Also:
        setReceiveBufferSize(int), setMaxReceiveSize(int), Connection.getCommsTimeout(), Socket

      • accept

        public Connection accept()
                  throws IOException
        Accepts new connection on server type connection, i.e. on ServerSocket. If new socket is returned from ServerSocket.accept(), creates new instance of TCPIPConnection with the new socket and returns it, otherwise returns null. The timeout for new connection accept is set by setReceiveTimeout, i.e. waits for new connection for this time and then, if none is requested, returns with null.
        Specified by:
        accept in class Connection
        Returns:
        the new accepted connection
        Throws:
        IOException - waiting for connection can cause an IOException
        See Also:
        TCPIPConnection(Socket), ServerSocket.accept(), ServerSocket.setSoTimeout(int)

      • setIOBufferSize

        public void setIOBufferSize(int ioBufferSize)
        Sets the size for the io buffers of streams for accessing the socket. The size can only be changed before actual opening of the connection.
        See Also:
        initialiseIOStreams(Socket)

      • setReceiveBufferSize

        public void setReceiveBufferSize(int receiveBufferSize)
        Sets the size of the receiving buffer, which is used for reading from the socket. A buffer of this size is allocated for the reading.
        See Also:
        receive()

      • setMaxReceiveSize

        public void setMaxReceiveSize(int maxReceiveSize)
        Sets the maximum size of the data which can be read in one call to the receive function. After reading of this amount of bytes the receive returns the data read even if there are more data in the socket.
        See Also:
        receive()

      • isOpened

        public boolean isOpened()
        Description copied from class: Connection
        This method returns true if the connection is open.
        Specified by:
        isOpened in class Connection
        See Also:
        Connection.isOpened()

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
